title: Coming to Tasmania
rule 1: Important information for all travellers interested in coming to Tasmania, including the conditions and processes for entering the State.

title: Essential Travellers
rule 2: Travellers who have spent time in a medium or high-risk area in the 14 days prior to arrival in Tasmania can apply to enter the State as an Essential Traveller.

title: Private airstrips and vessels
rule 3: The State Controller has prohibited any aeroplane or aircraft whose flight commences outside Tasmania from landing (other than in the case of an emergency or with prior consent) at any place within Tasmania other than specific airports.

title: Maritime ports
rule 4: Vessels arriving in Tasmanian waters must provide information to Biosecurity Tasmania

title: Quarantine
rule 5: Quarantine in Tasmania may be required if a person has been in 'close contact' with a confirmed case of COVID-19, or because they are travelling from identified areas that pose a risk of transmission of COVID-19.

title: Temporary visa holders
rule 6: Support, information and resources for Tasmania's temporary visa holders.

title: Travelling overseas
rule 7: A travel ban is in place for all Australians effective 25 March 2020. You will not be able to depart Australia to travel overseas.

title: International arrivals
rule 8: All international arrivals undertake 14 days mandatory quarantine in government-designated accommodation.
